metadata.title: CVE-2022-34480 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description: Within the lg_init() function, if several allocations succeedbut then one fails, an uninitialized pointer would have been freed despitenever being allocated. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required libnss3 - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.8 libnss3-tools - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.8 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
nss package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.8').
